page.title: 13Blockley churches
page.content: We went down to the vicarage to interview Mr. Sluman the vicar. Mr. Sluman felt that he had a call from God that said that God wanted him to be a vicar. Before Mr.Sluman came to Blockley he lived at Churchdown.He wanted a change from Churchdown so he went to see the Bishop and asked if he could have a change.So the Bishop agreed and said that he could come to Blockley. Mr.Sluman said that there were no advantages and no disadvantages about being a vicar in Blockley. There is an advantage being a vicar because you don't have to travel to get to work. The services are on Sunday at 8.00, 9.30, 11.00 and 3.00.And there is a service on Wednesday at 10.30.
